memberdef.argsstring: (const q7_t *Im_in, const uint16_t dim_im_in_x, const uint16_t dim_im_in_y, const uint16_t ch_im_in, const q7_t *wt, const uint16_t ch_im_out, const uint16_t dim_kernel_x, const uint16_t dim_kernel_y, const uint16_t padding_x, const uint16_t padding_y, const uint16_t stride_x, const uint16_t stride_y, const q7_t *bias, const uint16_t bias_shift, const uint16_t out_shift, q7_t *Im_out, const uint16_t dim_im_out_x, const uint16_t dim_im_out_y, q15_t *bufferA, q7_t *bufferB)
memberdef.name: riscv_convolve_HWC_q7_fast_nonsquare

detaileddescription.para:
Im_in
pointer to input tensor
dim_im_in_x
input tensor dimention x
dim_im_in_y
input tensor dimention y
ch_im_in
number of input tensor channels
wt
pointer to kernel weights
ch_im_out
number of filters, i.e., output tensor channels
dim_kernel_x
filter kernel size x
dim_kernel_y
filter kernel size y
padding_x
padding size x
padding_y
padding size y
stride_x
convolution stride x
stride_y
convolution stride y
bias
pointer to bias
bias_shift
amount of left-shift for bias
out_shift
amount of right-shift for output
Im_out
pointer to output tensor
dim_im_out_x
output tensor dimension x
dim_im_out_y
output tensor dimension y
bufferA
pointer to buffer space for input
bufferB
pointer to buffer space for output
The function returns either RISCV_MATH_SIZE_MISMATCH or RISCV_MATH_SUCCESS based on the outcome of size checking. This function is the version with full list of optimization tricks, but with some contraints: ch_im_in is multiple of 4 ch_im_out is multiple of 2
